comments.body: I think you should allow for this function to get and return lists, i.e if i specify one disk by ID and another with a number - I want to Init both eventually

Allowing for lists would make the behavior of this module different from how the `win_format` and `win_partition` modules work (as well as the Unix equivalent modules such as `filesystem`).

The loop structure can be used on the task to provide a list with multiple disks and identifications. For example:

```yaml
  vars:
    - disks:
        - diskNumber: 1
          style: gpt
        - uniqueId: "60022480622E439002680C84CD374969"
        - path: '\\?\scsi#disk&ven_msft&prod_virtual_disk#2&1f4adffe&0&000001#{53f56307-b6bf-11d0-94f2-00a0c91efb8b}'
          style: mbr

  tasks:
    - name: Initialize Disks
      win_initialize_disk:
        disk_number: '{{ item.diskNumber | default(omit) }}'
        uniqueid: '{{ item.uniqueId | default(omit) }}'
        path: '{{ item.path | default(omit) }}'
        style: '{{ item.style | default(omit) }}'
      loop: '{{ disks }}'

```

This also has the advantage that the other parameters can be specified differently for each disk.

Maybe this is a good candidate as an example in the documentation?
